availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. Rankin (Grant County State Rep)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Laura M. Rankin. Father of Kate Rankin and Rowan Rankin. Attorney in Williamstown, Kentucky, in 1850. Census enumerator in Grant County in 1850. Master of the Grant Masonic Lodge No. 85 in Williamstown in 1851. Attorney in Williamstown in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Grant County from 1861 to 1863.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Town of Williamstown, p. 362; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Town of Williamstown, p. 184; "An Act to Incorporate Grant Lodge, No. 85, of Free and Accepted Masons," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky Passed at November Session, 1850, vol. 2 (Frankfort: A. G. Hodges & Co, State Printers, 1851), 396-97; Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, Ky.: Collins & Co., 1882), 291; Find A Grave, "William Stevenson Rankin (1821-1874)," Memorial #154700058, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/154700058 (accessed November, 22, 2017).
